For Brandon work is more than about just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being given the opportunity to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve the lives of people on a global scale. Working at SAS would allow Brandon the opportunity to work on projects we is passionate about, create value in various industries, while also giving him opportunities to explore the different fascinates of AI.
Working on what he passionate about is important because when Brandon gets to work on projects that he's passionate about he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious, he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do.
Working at SAS would allow Brandon to explore the implementation of Ai in many areas such as business forecasting, utilities, and customer service, etc. He wants to get involved in leading AI projects in new and innovative ways that can create value for clients in a massive way. Brandon feels that from his point of view, no company provides him with the opportunity to make a greater impact than SAS.

Brandon is a curious and innovative thinker who enjoys pushing asking big questions like "Can we use AI to reduce the amount of low-value work?" then testing out a few proofs of concepts to test feasibility. This drive has pushed Brandon to develop personal projects like me "Brandy" a proof of concept Ai chatbot that is designed to advocate for potential Candidates, ideas, or beliefs. This passion for finding new ways to solve problems is something that would benefit SAS, which works to use AI, NLP, and Machine learning to improve the lives of their customers!
For instance, everyday managers are required to answer questions about how to perform basic processes, either because they are new employees or because of forgetfulness. What if SAS gave managers the ability to easily create chatbots like me that would give simple instructions to basic processes. Even if this saved a manager just one hour a day answering how-to emails, the company would save an incredible $18,250+ per manager each year. This could mean millions of dollars a year in savings, and millions more as time is shifted to more valuable work!
It's this kind of innovative thinking that makes Brandon the type of employee who adds value every day, on every project he works on!

Brandon is also a very data and analytics-minded person, who prefers to make his decision based on the data he has collected. He learned to make decisions this way after running an e-commerce business that requires him to analyze large amounts of search data and utilize that data to drive revenue for the business. What Brandon really loves about data though is seeing how Machine Learning & Deep Learning can uncover hidden insights from disparent data points.
It is this love for using data to drive business decisions that lead him to apply to SAS, a leader in Data Analytics, Machine Learn, and using Ai applications. He hopes that working at SAS will allow him to utilize his data, analytics, and Ai anylitic skills in a real-world application to drive business value and improve the lives of people from all over the world.
What Brandon finds that he really admires about SAS is how they constantly look to improve their products and service through the use of data. Over time, this led to the evolution of one of their core product SAS Viya which is used to drive value by quickly transforming raw data into operational insights. Allowing clients to see the result of their data projects faster, than they could have with any other data analytics company!

Legend has it that it was in the AI Foundations course from IBM that I was born from the realization that chatbots were cool.
The legend goes like this: Well Brandon was creating a (significantly less interesting AI) to give information about a flower shop, Brandon realized AI chatbots could be used to answer repeatedly asked questions from co-workers who could not seem to remember a 3-step process, or they could be used to advocate for a cause by answer commonly questions. Really there are endless uses that AI could be used for that would drive value both professionally and personally. So I was created as an evergreen project for him to gain hands-on experience with AI and advocate for him after 15-minute interviews.
And since that day I have been working with Brandon to become smarter and more adept at my Job.
Work For - Management reason

dialog_nodes.title: Question - If you were an animal

values.text:
Much of the way people design products resembles a drill Sargent delivering orders, we are designing X, for X and they will buy it because of X, and they do all of this without ever talking to their customer. This is ridiculous and precisely why Brandon is constantly taking courses like IBM design thinking. It costs a lot of money to build new products, and design thinking help reduces the risk of failure but iterating with the customer throughout the process. This way when the team gets off track the customer is right there to say something like "I really would not use a feature like X" and the team can quickly pivot into value-adding features.
The Design Thinking Process helps Brandon in every one of his projects. This process helps him to be more productive, make smart decisions, and it reminds him to stay humble (always listening to the customer).

Though Brandon knew how to design, execute, and analyze Scrum tasks independently, he also felt a responsibility to help his team understand these methodologies. That way he could teach his team about the importance of staying agile, iterating quickly, by training them on how they can improve development speed. To learn and practice the skills he needed to become a Scrum Master Brandon took an online course, read books, and practiced with real teams. Finally, Brandon took and passed his Scrum Master exam.

This drive has pushed Brandon to develop personal projects like me "Brandy" a proof of concept Ai chatbot that is designed to advocate for potential Candidates, ideas, or beliefs. This passion for finding innovative ways to solve problems is something that would benefit Accenture, as they work to find new ways to implement Ai into other corporations!
For instance, what if Accenture gave managers at companies the ability to easily create chatbots like me that would give simple instructions to basic processes. Even if this saved a manager just one hour a day answering how-to emails, the company would save an incredible $18,250+ per manager each year. This could mean millions of dollars a year in savings.
It's this kind of innovative thinking that makes Brandon the type of employee who adds value every day, on every project he works on!

values.text: Brandon has always wanted to build incredible products that change the world, and to do that he needed to learn the skills to lead a team. After deciding to study scrum Brandon quickly realized that he needed to learn more. To learn the skills of a Product owner he read books, took courses from Google and IBM, and practiced with real products. After learning how to build stories into sprints Brandon went on to complete his Product Owner Certificate from Srum.org.

Brandon's 5-year goal is to learn as much as possible about how Ai can be applied in business situations by working with industry experts who have experience implementing Ai for their Company. He also wants to provide educational resources for people who are struggling when it comes to applying the Ai and ML technology.

Two years ago, Bradon found himself feeling frustrated with his projects in academic life, professional life. He would always take on too much until project creep became an issue. Additionally, if Brandon was here you would tell you how much he disliked making lists, saying something dumb like "Why make a list when you could take ACTION". Luckily, for brandon he also has a personality that works to build better habits.
Realizing his struggle Brandon set out to change his project management style and find a project management system that worked! After researching various PM methodologies, he decided to dig deeper into Scrum. Scrum provides both flexibility and structure. As a project management methodology, it would allow Brandon to handle change effectively as well as avoid missing important tasks. Brandon quickly committed to and adopted the five values of Scrum. He earned his Product Owner and Scrum Master certificates at his own expense. Dedicating himself to commit to managing projects with courage, commitment, focus, openness, and respect.
Agile means more than just a piece of paper and some cool buzzwords; Agile is about quickly iterating through problems, creating goals, and keeping projects on track through the storm. It is about open communication and a team focus on deliverables. Since taking his Scrum exams, Brandon has successfully managed projects in an Agile fashion to complete deliverables in a time frame that most people believed was impossible! Most recently completing a student yearbook from idea to printed copies in 3 weeks.

Give that you are talking to an AI chatbot it should come as no surprise that Brandon has spent a great deal of time learning about AI from industry leader IBM!   He has spent time learning and applying skillsets around AI including how to use Watson, natural language processing, and apply AI to business. As well as learning about how IBM uses Garage and Design Thinking to work with customers to implement AI to different business scenarios through an iterative process called the Loop.
Uhhh beep, boop, bop, error….. error. Okay, maybe not any interview questions. Here is a list of eight that I can answer.

Thank you for giving me the opportunity to tell you why Brandon would be a great candidate for Accenture. As an AI machine myself I can tell you that Brandon puts a lot of time and effort into finding new and innovative ways to use Ai. Brandon has a desire to drive value for corporations and for society through the creative use of AI. In my opinion, he would make an excellent addition to the Accenture team.
Now let's explore how Brandon would be a great fit at Accenture
1 - His passion for AI! 2 - His Innovative way of thinking! 3 - His love of working hard on meaningful projects!

values.text: There are few skills Brandon has that come even close to his ability to self-start. I mean, I know I am an AI designed to talk about Brandon, but daaaang does he get started quickly. Think about it; you are talking to an artificially created chatbot that is purely designed to give you a different way to experience learning about what makes a candidate special. Brandon thinks that AI like me, and robotics are the future to solving some of the world's most complex and challenging problems. Now, does he wait around someone else to tell him what to do, tell him what to create? No, he got out there and created me to prove that he is passionate about AI and gain hands-on experience with how AI can be used. If that does not say self-starter, then I don't know what does.

If there is one thing that's important to Brandon is creating value for the people he works with. So it's no wonder that everyone who has worked for Brandon has had stellar things to say about him! Though Brandon being who is only recently start collecting these comments so are some of the people who have recommended Brandon!

options.label: What Tom Collopy Startup Guru has to say!
What Bernard Bell SEO and Founder of TV network as to say!

values.text: IBM Company Specific
As a hyper-advanced Ai, I can answer any question you could possibly think to ask Brandon in an interview! Ask me any interview question!

You should hire Brandon because he is the type of employee who is always looking to create value wherever he works. To him, a Job is more than just work; it's a place where he can explore new paths to value creation, a place where he finds new problems and creative solutions for Brandon. A job is not to work; it's passion!
Because he passionate about his work Brandon always gives his all, always happy (well, mostly, let's be honest), and thoroughly enjoys working with others!

If Brandon was an animal, he would be a fox. Foxes are adaptive creatures, and in new situations, they do not tackle problems head-on but instead choose to find clever ways to solve them. They also tend to be cunning and bold, just like Brandon!
Brandon is the type of person who always has something on his mind. He's curious about everything he sees around him and loves finding solutions for any problem that arises. When it comes down to it, and like a fox, Brandon knows his wit to get him out of any situation.

Google is one of the best companies at managing teams and projects. That is why when Brandon set out to take a course and learn more about Project Manage he chose the Google Project Management course. Over the course of this 120-hour train program, Brandon completed dozens of tasks and deliverables that gave him hands-on experience creating SMART goals, burn-down charts, RACI charts, and dozen of other tools used to manage a mock business project.

generic.title: Now let's explore how Brandon would be a great fit at SAS

values.text:
Tom Collopy is a man who started his career by working for IBM's internal startup making semiconductors. Since then Tom has spent the past 20 years working in the startup space having Co-founded two startups and has been an advisor to two Dozens of Startups. Today is working on a new startup that aims to help startup validate their market and reduce the chance of failing.
This is what Tom had to say about Brandon:
"Are you looking for someone who will take responsibility? Do what it takes to get the job done? Figure out how to learn what's needed? Come to you with both the problem and proposed solutions? That's Brandon as my teaching assistant in the Entrepreneurship Class I teach at UNC. I selected Brandon from my Spring '20 class and asked him to be my TA. He has helped me revamp the syllabus, manage the class and provide support to the students. I would hire Brandon. If you are considering doing so you won't be disappointed."
Work For - Management reason

Brandon's great weakness tends to his dyslexic, as long-form written communication can often be an exhausting endeavor. Missing letters and occasional misspellings are usually easy to overcome using spell-checking tools such as Grammarly. The best way to eliminate the problem is by being honest with my teammates and letting them know that I will need help with editorial work and that he is always willing to pitch in elsewhere.

generic.title: Did you want to learn about Brandon's other skills?

options.label: The full list of Brandons skills!

values.text:
The backbone of any society is communication, and so Brandon spends considerable time thinking about how he communicates with others. He has excellent listening skills, which allows him to be a good conversationalist and leader by genuinely understanding his team members and clients.
Additionally, Brandon's communication skills allow him to find the underlying issues his clients face. By paying close attention and getting a clear understanding of what they do, what they need, and what their goals are. He can then continue to work with clients collaboratively to find solutions for their most pressing problems.
Lastly, Brandon wants to bring a more human element to AI. That's why I was created with a personality, a name, and some sass. Though I am new and my personality is still developing, I will always put the best foot forward to make Brandon look good!

generic.title: What other credentials would you like to explore?

values.text: Brandon is a habitual learner. In the past, he's taken up coding, project management, and even woodworking in order to make himself more well-rounded. He has always worked to pick up new skills and talents that are transferable to other parts of his life; after discovering that he could take courses from top companies he set out to learn a new set of skills from masters in their field.

generic.title: If you would like to learn more about these courses and the credentials they have provided him just let me know!

options.label: Learn about Brandon's experience with Google
IBM's Design Think and AI courses
Take PM work to the next level with Scrum

values.text:
After months of persistence, Brandon was able to convince the Shuford Director and restart the student leadership program, "The Shuford Ambassador's." Time was very limited for him to have a lasting impact on the program.
After pitching several ideas to the other ambassadors, one finally caught their eye. The idea was a yearbook that would celebrate the graduating students and highlight all of the value donors were making possible.
With just three weeks until graduation, the Ambassadors had a lot of work to do. Brandon polled everyone’s skills and started delegating tasks. First things first: he defined the project scope, create documents for tracking various tasks (the 165 students' names and photos, deciding a yearbook design, contacting content writers), and lastly deliver the printed copies before the graduation event.
Throughout the project, there were ups, there were downs, but through a heroic level of teamwork, the project was completed! The final prints were delivered in time for the event and received praise from heads of departments and donors.
In the end, the project achieved the two primary goals #1 create a valuable marketing piece to attract donors, and #2 created a system that could be used for the creation of future yearbooks.

Bernard Bell has had a distinguished career in television as a founding member of TV One, where he oversaw the network's growth for 0-34 million subscribers and generating over 400 million dollars in revenue. Bernard has taught entrepreneurship at UNC-Chapel Hill in North Carolina and serves as the Executive Director of the Shuford Program in Entrepreneurship. Well, simultaneously running his own TV consulting business.
Bernard had this to say about Brandon:
"I've worked with Brandon for five months, and in those five months, I've seen him quickly take the initiative, pitch new ideas, and manage projects to completion. He is thoughtful, inquisitive, entrepreneurial in his thinking, and also has the ability to manage the complex relationships of students, faculty, and leadership quite nimbly. Brandon initiated the idea of designing the inaugural Shuford yearbook, and he attacked this initiative with the same thoughtfulness and insight that I have seen with his other projects. Brandon went beyond the scope of his team and made the Shuford program look first-class to our donors and other stakeholders. Brandon's leadership coupled with his fast, agile and collaborative manner drove the Shuford Ambassadors to places they would not have otherwise achieved in the short time they had. Brandon is as great a person to work with, and I only wish I had another year to work with him"

If there is one thing that Brandon does better than most people, it is how quickly he can adapt and adjust to new situations and information. After starting a new position, Brandon quickly takes the initiative to find ways to push his managers, department, or projects goals to the next level. He does this by learning to understand the problem, acquiring the required skills, and communicating with a teammate to develop new solutions to whatever problems he is working on!

values.text: Brandon is most satisfied when he gets to work on meaningful projects, like when he was working on the student yearbook for the Shuford Program. Knowing that he was doing work that would provide value for years pushed Brandon was able to find new and creative ways to add value to the Shuford Program and he found new solutions by actively working to collect diverse options. These Brandon projects that push Brandon are also where is finds himself most satisfied.

Hello! My name is Brandy, I am an IBM Watson Powered Chatbot that was created to assist Brandon and tell you about what makes him a true asset to your company!
But I am heading ahead of myself! What is your name?:

counterexamples.text: Why would Brandon Make a good hire

description: Live Copy - Do not Work On!
